AltTable.Description: This function returns method value from the first field table or second field table. If the First Field's Table object has the value then it returns the method value else it returns the method value from the second field's Table object.
AltTable.Name: AltTable

Column.Description: This function is used to check the number of columns in multi-column report.
Column.Name: Column

ColumnNumber.Description: This function is used to return the current column number in a multi-column report.
ColumnNumber.Name: ColumnNumber

ContextKeyword.Description: This function is used to get the title of the current Report or Menu which can be used to search the context sensitive /online help based on the report or Menu title.
ContextKeyword.Name: ContextKeyword

CurrentTable.Description: This function returns name of table currently shown in table. It is for usage when we use 'Change Table' action.
CurrentTable.Name: CurrentTable

CurrentTableObj.Description: This function returns the method value of the selected object from the table associated with the currently focused field in the report.
CurrentTableObj.Name: CurrentTableObj

DescName.Description: This function provides the description or name of the UI object in which it is used. It is useful when certain titles are to be displayed in reports. To display the report name as a title, some fixed strings can be concatenated with the value returned from the function and used as a title.
DescName.Name: DescName

EditData.Description: This function returns the Value of the Current Field. $$EditData will check if the current field is edited and returns the edited value.
EditData.Name: EditData

FieldColumn.Description: This function returns the column number of the field. While counting the field columns it includes the sub fields also.
FieldColumn.Name: FieldColumn

FieldIndex.Description: This function returns the index of the field. Index is maintained only for leaf level fields, for all others 0 is returned
FieldIndex.Name: FieldIndex

FieldKey.Description: This functions evaluates the result of the expression in field hierarchy and returna key string
FieldKey.Name: FieldKey

FieldLevel.Description: This function returns the depth of the field. The depth/level starts from 1 at parent most field and incremented by 1 for every subsequent level
FieldLevel.Name: FieldLevel

GetOnTheFlyString.Description: This function returns the on-the-fly string entered by user.
GetOnTheFlyString.Name: GetOnTheFlyString

IsActionObject.Description: This function returns whether object behaves as an action object in table. This depends upon 'Behave As' written at object level.
IsActionObject.Name: IsActionObject

IsConfigObject.Description: This function returns whether object behaves as config object in table. This depends upon 'Behave As' written at object level.
IsConfigObject.Name: IsConfigObject

IsExternalActionObject.Description: This function returns whether object behaves as External Config objectin table. This depends upon 'Behave As' written at object level.
IsExternalActionObject.Name: IsExternalActionObject

IsFileTypeSupported.Description: This function checks whether the specified format / file extension is supported by the system. This is decided based on if any Open with program is registered against this File extension
IsFileTypeSupported.Name: IsFileTypeSupported

IsLabelObject.Description: This function returns whether object behaves as label object in table. This depends upon 'Behave As' written at object level.
IsLabelObject.Name: IsLabelObject

IsOnTheFlyItemSelected.Description: This function is used to check if the item selected from the table is On The Fly object or not.
IsOnTheFlyItemSelected.Name: IsOnTheFlyItemSelected

IsStartupValue.Description: This function is used to check wheteher the value is the original value or not.
IsStartupValue.Name: IsStartupValue

KeyExplode.Description: This function checks if the keys Alt + F1 Or Shift + Enter are pressed or not and returns the logical values 'yes' Or 'No' accordingly
KeyExplode.Name: KeyExplode

Line.Description: This function gives the Object number of the current collection.
Line.Name: Line

LineKey.Description: This functions evaluates the result of the expression in Line hierarchy and returna key string
LineKey.Name: LineKey

PrevFld.Description: The function $$PrevFld is used to extract the value of the filed in the previous field. This is useful in Multi column reports where this function is used to get the value of the previous field or to find the difference between two previous field. The function $$PrevFld without any parameter retrieves the value of previous field.   It can optionally accept a single parameter which specifies the field number the value of which is to be extracted.
PrevFld.Name: PrevFld

PrevFldTotal.Description: The function $$PrevFldTotal is used to extract the total value of the previous fields. This is useful in Multi column reports. It does not accept any parameter and returns a value of type same as the type of previous fields.
PrevFldTotal.Name: PrevFldTotal

Table.Description: This function returns the method value selected from the table which mentioned in the field using the field value.
Table.Name: Table

TableNumItems.Description: This function returns the number of items in the table. This function is to be invoked from the field level only.
TableNumItems.Name: TableNumItems

TableObj.Description: This function returns the Function Value / Method Value from the Table which is mentioned in the Field level attribute.
TableObj.Name: TableObj

TplColumnObject.Description: This function evaluates the given parameter in the context of the Object associated at the Current Column Object Level if available. Otherwise it will default to current object context.
TplColumnObject.Name: TplColumnObject

TplLine.Description: This function gives the count of current object in the current collection.
TplLine.Name: TplLine

Value.Description: This function refers to the value set in the field. The value set in the field is accessible within that field definition using this function. It also considers the values entered by the user.
Value.Name: Value
